alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 10:23PM MDT until August 25 at 1:15AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Broadwater County in southwestern Montana... West central Meagher County in central Montana... * Until 115 AM MDT. * At 1021 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain of 0.5 inch to 1 inch per hour across the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. * Flash flooding will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Broadwater and west central Meagher Counties in the Big Belt Mountains. Excessive rainfall over the Woods Creek burn scar will result in debris flow. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
